diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, chills, headache, nausea, and fatigue.
diseases.prevention: Use mosquito nets, insect repellent, and take antimalarial drugs.
diseases.treatment: Antimalarial medications like chloroquine or artemisinin-based combination therapies.

diseases.name: Tuberculosis
diseases.description: A bacterial infection caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, primarily affecting the lungs.
diseases.symptoms: Cough with sputum, chest pain, weight loss, and night sweats.
diseases.prevention: BCG vaccine, good ventilation, and early treatment of active cases.
diseases.treatment: A 6-9 month course of antibiotics like isoniazid and rifampicin.

diseases.name: HIV/AIDS
diseases.description: A viral infection that attacks the immune system, caused by the Human Immunodeficiency Virus.
diseases.symptoms: Fever, weight loss, fatigue, and opportunistic infections.
diseases.prevention: Safe sex practices, needle exchange programs, and pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP).
diseases.treatment: Antiretroviral therapy (ART) to manage the virus.

areas.name: Asia
areas.description: Tuberculosis is widespread due to dense populations and poor sanitation.

areas.name: Europe
areas.description: Rising cases of HIV/AIDS due to limited awareness and stigma.
